heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 06 September 2025, lasting 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (180°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 54.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 857 m), light levels (up 14445 lux), and pressure (up 9 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13110 lux), cloud levels (up 988 m), and feels like temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 856.8m lower than yesterday, 174.3m lower than the past week, 988.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 737m to a maximum of 4780m, averaging 1537.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1711.3m and 2530m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and dim or diffuse light conditions. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
